Codenhance

Friendly Coding Lessons for Biologists

What is Codenhance?

This site contains a collection of tutorials, courses, recommendations and gentle encouragement for biologists looking to add the word "computational" to their title.

Start from Zero

No computer science background? You can learn to code. Computers hate you? You can learn to code. No idea where to start? Start here.

Write Real Code

You'll use the same (free) tools that professionals use to write real code that runs everywhere -- from your laptop to a supercomputer.

Build a Portfolio

Share your code on GitHub. Get feedback, get motivated, and get better at coding, fast. Amaze your friends and potential employers.

You'll Learn:

  • Python
  • Git
  • GitHub
  • Vim
  • The command line

... all in the process of building and publishing your own tools to analyze genetic sequence data.

HTML

PrismJS is used as the syntax highlighter here.

Below are the details of the custom PrismJS build used in this template. You can build your own version via their website should you need to.

  • Compression level: Minified
  • Theme: Okaidia
  • Languages: Markup, CSS, C-like, JavaScript, PHP and Python

    <p class="my-style">
      Hello World!
    </p>

      font-size: 16px;
      -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
      -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;
    }

Full Documentation

If your documentation is very long you can host the full docs page (including FAQ etc) on GitHub and provide a Call to Action button below to direct users there.

More on GitHub

About

Hi there, I'm Brian. I have a Master's in Information and Computer Science from the Univeristy of Hawai'i at Manoa, and I work at a government research facility where we use text editors and algorithms to protect the country's food supply. No big deal.

I teach biologists to code because it is immensely gratifying to grant superpowers to another human being.

About

Hi there, I'm Brian. I have a Master's in Information and Computer Science from the Univeristy of Hawai'i at Manoa, and I work at a government research facility where we use text editors and algorithms to protect the country's food supply. No big deal.

I teach biologists to code because it is immensely gratifying to grant superpowers to another human being.
